loans.name: Srean

texts.en:
Srean is 52 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She has been running a general store for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a generator mechanic who earns about $12 daily. One of her children is employed in a casino and earns about $5 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Srean is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase spare parts to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Leonisa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Leonisa is borrowing 26,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell and livestock to raise.

Leonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell and livestock to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy books and materials for his studies

loans.name: Leang Hun

texts.en: Leang Hun is 25 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling meatballs for more than two years, earning approximately 14 USD per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) helps her run the business. Leang Hun requests a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase a tri-cycle for transporting meatballs to sell. This purchase will help her easily transport meatballs to sell in the local community. In the future, she would like to run a meatball shop and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house in five years.

loans.use: to purchase a tri-cycle for transporting meatballs to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is from Macupa, Tangub City. She is 47 years old. Marissa is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Marissa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising bananas for sale. Marissa been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Marissa joined GDMPC. Marissa is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is married with three children. She is 46 years old, residing at Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Imelda owns and operates a farm, planting bananas to earn a living. She's been in this business for 7 years and each month she earns 7,000 PHP with this type of business. She requested a loan of 12,500 PHP to purchase pesticides. Imelda has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Imelda wants to build a jewelry store and to finish educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides

loans.name: Tang Oan

texts.en: Tang Oan is 24 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Her husband is a firewood vendor. He earns about 6 USD daily. Tang Oan is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use for transporting firewood to sell. This will help her husband generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a small truck for transporting firewood and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use for transporting firewood to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 48 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children. Editha has raised pigs to sell for eight years to make a living. She usually gets 6,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month. 

She has requested a loan of 13,500 PHP from GDMPC to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Editha been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, Editha hopes to expand and improve her business to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Jean is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fishing net, bamboo and other fishing gear for her fishing business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, bamboo and other fishing gear.

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru:
Марина – из Новой Каховки. Она занимается предпринимательством уже 19 лет. Марина арендует торговую площадь у администрации местного торгового центра, торгует качественной женской одеждой. 
Марина планирует закупить осеннюю одежду под реализацию, а именно кофты, свитера, юбки и брюки, но ей не хватает собственных средств. Именно поэтому она обратилась в КИВА за финансовой помощью суммой в 4 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Marina is from Novaya Kahovka. She has been in business for 19 years. She rents retail space from the administration of the local shopping center where she sells good quality womenswear. 

Marina wants to buy autumn clothing to sell, specifically shirts, sweaters, skirts, and pants, but she does not have the money to do so. For this reason, she has come to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 4,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia.

loans.use: to buy autumn clothing to sell, specifically shirts, sweaters, skirts and pants

loans.name: Luis Andrey

texts.es: Luis Andrey, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está soltero, vive con sus hermanos y padres, los cual son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la preparación del terreno en forma manual y así conservar mejor los suelos, comprar fertilizantes, semilla de maíz y otros productos que requiere para hacer la siembra del cultivo. Además pagar mano de obra de la siembra y asistencia del cultivo como lo son la eliminación de maleza en forma manual para no utilizar químicos y algunos trabajos culturales como hacer niveles para evitar la erosión de los suelos por la lluvia principalmente, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Con esta posibilidad de crédito espera tener todo preparado a tiempo y aprovechar todo el periodo de lluvia, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener emplearlo en cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Luis Andrey is 23 years old, single, and lives with his brothers and parents, who are his top priority. With his loan, he intends to manually prepare the land. This is how he conserves the best soil - he buys fertilizer, corn seeds, and other products which he needs for cultivation. Furthermore, it is to pay for the labor of growing and caring for the crops by manually eliminating weeds to avoid use of chemicals, as well as some cultivation work like making layers to avoid soil erosion due to the rain. This helps him assure good work. With the possibility of this loan, he hopes to have everything prepared on time and to take advantage of the rainy season, as well as to put many years of experience into practice as he handles basic crops. Additionally, he will be able to buy the best, top quality products so that his plantation will be well-designed and healthy, and to have adequate production in the short-term. He will use the income from the harvest that he hopes to obtain to complete some family goals and continue investing in more crops. This is his first loan received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans from government banks before, but FEDECOSUR has provided him the loan with great ease and the interest rates are much lower.

loans.use: to grow corn.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: Mariée à un menuisier du nom de Jean, Pascaline est âgée de 51 ans. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et trois restent à leur charge. Pascaline et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pascaline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix huit ans que Pascaline vend des poissons fumés et des piments dans sa région. Pascaline exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Pascaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Pascaline sollicite un cinquième crédit. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les prêts antérieurs reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Pascaline is 51 years old and married to a carpenter named Jean. The couple has five children, three of whom still live in their care. Some of their children have received schooling. Pascaline and her husband live together with their children and both help to cover the various household expenses. Pascaline did not go to school.

Pascaline has been selling smoked fish and spices in her region for almost 18 years now. She runs her business with passion, which enables her to support herself and her children. She stocks up at a market in Benin.

Striving to satisfy her customers, Pascaline is seeking a fifth loan. The loan will help her to better meet the demand of her customers and earn more profit. The previous loans were all correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish and spices.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with 7 children. She is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Evelyn is a farmer and she manages a corn production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 17 years and every month she earns 6,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer. Evelyn been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. 

In the future, Evelyn hopes to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Marijen

texts.en: Marijen is a 34-year-old, married woman from Dauis, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 8, while the youngest is 3. Marijen sells fish in her community as a source of livelihood. Her husband is a fisherman. She earns 3,000 pesos a month by doing the fish vending. She requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase a fish net, and have additional capital to acquire more fish to sell. Marijen would like to expand her business by investing in other business ventures to support her family and at the same time to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a fish net and additional fish to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Alma works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Alma is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is married with five children. He is 47 years old and resides in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Nestor raises corn for sale to earn a living and has been 18 years in this business. Each month, he earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase fertilizers. In 2010, Nestor joined GDMPC. In the future, Nestor wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es: Manuel Ángel, tiene la edad  de 33 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cual son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra fertilizantes, semilla de maíz y otros productos que requiere para hacer la siembra del cultivo. Además pagar mano de obra de la siembra y asistencia del cultivo como lo son la eliminación de maleza en forma manual para no utilizar químicos y algunos trabajos culturales como hacer niveles para evitar la erosión de los suelos por la lluvia principalmente, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener emplearlo en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Manuel Ángel is thirty-three years old, is married, and lives with his children and wife, who are his main priority.  With the loan, he intends to buy fertilizers, corn seeds, and other products he requires to carry out the sowing of his crop.  He will also pay laborers to help with planting and crop assistance, like manual weeding in order to not use chemicals and some farming work, like making levels to prevent ground erosion due mainly to rain.  In doing this, he is sure to do good work.  

He intends to take advantage of the good climate and ground conditions that he counts on for his crop, and to also put into practice his several years experience in handling basic grains.  

Furthermore, he will be able to buy the best products of the best quality so that his plantation has good development and health, and so that he has good production in the short-term.  With the profits from the harvest that he hopes to make, he will invest in the well-being and studies of his family, meet some family goals, and continue investing more in his crops. 

This is the first loan that he receives from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other loans from state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy the materials/labor needed for planting corn.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia, a 48-year-old married woman, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where she has cultivated bananas for sale to make a living for 11 years now. It normally gives Virgilia a monthly income of 5,000 PHP.

Having joined GDMPC last 2011, she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She's dreaming of augmenting her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Ханифа женщина в возрасте 39 лет.   Она замужем имеет троих детей. Занимается откормом скотов на дому и продажей молока.   В наличие имеет 4 голов крупно рогатого скота и хорошо разбирается в преимуществах своего дело .     У них также имеется дойная корова и ее дети продают молоко соседям каждый день. От этого вида деятельности у них хороший доход . Поэтому Ханифа старается развивать этот бизнес.   Для этого она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит и купить скот для увеличения поголовья. Ханифа заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Hanifa is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children. She fattens cattle at home and also sells milk. She has 4 head of cattle and is very skilled at managing this business. She also has a dairy cow, and her children sell milk to their neighbours every day. This brings in a good income, which is why Hanifa now wants to develop her business. In order to do this, she has approached Arvand for a loan to buy cattle so she can increase her herd. She thanks lenders in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy necessary materials, such as a table and a chair to have an additional station for acrylic nails.

loans.name: Yissegbe Group

texts.fr: YISSEGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette Médégnonmi dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans. Antoinette Médégnonmi est mariée à un certain Calixte. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Antoinette Médégnonmi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près d’une vingtaine d’années que Antoinette Médégnonmi mène comme activité la vente de bouillie accompagnée des beignets de façon ambulante. Antoinette Médégnonmi exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Antoinette Médégnonmi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Antoinette Médégnonmi sollicite un sixième crédit avec le second membre du groupe YISSEGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
YISSEGBE is a group of three persons whose members are friends residing in the same district. The group's representative, Antoinette Médégnonmi (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 47 years old and married to a man named Calixte. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. The couple live together with the children and jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Antoinette did not attend school. For nearly twenty years, she has been running a business going from place to place selling porridge served with beignets. Antoinette operates this business with passion, and this enables her to support herself. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Antoinette is requesting a sixth loan with the second member of the group YISSEGBE. This loan will be used by them to respond better to the demands of their customers and to make more profit. The previous  loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cornmeal to making porridge and beignets

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is from Ozamis Cty, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Anelyn is married and has two children. To make a living, Anelyn raises pigs for sale. She's been involved in raising pigs for 11 years and earns 6,500 PHP a month for these activities. 

Anelyn is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to buy feeding supplies. In 2007, Anelyn joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old, married to Armando and has six children. To make a living, the couple raise crops to sell. They have planted and harvested rice for over 10 years now and usually make PHP 15,000 each harvest season. Their profits are used for food and for revolving capital for the farming business. 

Teresita is taking the loan so she can invest in making her crops healthier through applying fertilizers and insecticides. She is asking for PHP 20,000 to buy five bags of fertilizers and three liters of insecticides used in farming.

Teresita hopes to achieve an abundant yield every harvest season and to attain financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy five bags of fertilizers and three liters of insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn is married to Faustino; they have a farming business as their source of income. They plant and harvest rice twice a year. They have been in their business for five years now. Remalyn has four young children whom she provides for and tries to give a good education. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. 

In the future, Remalyn would like to become a successful rice grower, to achieve more profits and uplift her family's poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is 55 years old and living peacefully in Lanna with her spouse and children. The couple have eight children; one is still attending school. Others have settled into marriage and were not able to finish their degrees due to financial instability. They were able to make PHP 15,000 each harvest season twice a year. It was just enough for the family's sustenance.

She would like to increase crop production and is now borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and pesticides) used in farming. 

In the future, Lucresia would like to achieve a plentiful harvest and save income to use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and pesticides) used in farming.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is happily married to Zosimo, and they have two children attending school. She is already 50 years old. With her husband, she manages a hectare plot of land on which they plant and harvest rice to sell. Elizabeth wanted to increase her crop production; that is why she is asking for additional capital of 20,000 Philippines pesos to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in the farming business. These farm inputs will help ensure healthy crops to harvest upon maturity. 

With the good funds earned, she will save for school fees and someday achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in the farming business.

loans.name: Darwin Carlos

texts.es:
Darwin es  un joven de 18 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Darwin pudo estudiar una carrera técnica, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Darwin trabaja como auxiliar de recursos humanos en una empresa  de su ciudad, desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y porque es muy responsable.
Darwin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de prendas de vestir y calzado de la temporada de verano, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños; de esta manera Darwin iniciará su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, así pues el espera que le vaya muy bien, para que así poco a poco pueda ampliar su negocio y lograr su sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Darwin is an 18 year old, single young man who lives in the town of Pucallpa with his parents and brothers. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a strong desire to achieve. Thanks to his effort and the support of his parents, Darwin was able to study a technical degree. In his free time, he likes to dedicate a little time to reading and occasionally cooks a delicious rice and chicken dish to share with his family. Though his own initiative and a lot of determination, Darwin works day by day as a resource assistant at a business in his town. From the early hours when his labor begins, he can work for approximately eight hours daily and believes it goes very well because of his good performance and because he is very responsible.

Darwin feels very grateful to the loaners at Kiva. Thanks to the help they have provided him, he will complete the purchase of summer garnmets and footwear for ladies, gentlemen, and children. In this way, Darwin will begin a small clothing and footwear business. He hopes it goes very well so that, little by little, he can expand his business and achieve his his dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Sumber Usaha Group

texts.en:
This is the fourth loan for the Sumber Usaha  group. They still need financial support for their businesses, until they are able to continue business with their own capital. Every sale of pork, they are saving money to have venture capital. 

The Sari Usaha group has chosen a new head, Ni Wayan. Ni Wayan will use her loan to purchase a sow. She plans to sell piglets for pig roll. These kinds of pigs require easier care than superior pigs and are sold faster. She hopes her plan will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase a sow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Pascaline Mèlèmè

texts.fr: Mariée à un maçon du nom de Martin, Pascaline Mèlèmè est âgée de 40 ans. Le couple a deux enfants dont certains scolarisés et à leur charge. Pascaline Mèlèmè et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pascaline Mèlèmè a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Pascaline Mèlèmè vend auprès d’une place publique du Bénin. Pascaline Mèlèmè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Pascaline Mèlèmè s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Pascaline Mèlèmè sollicite un troisième crédit. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les prêts antérieurs reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Married to a mason named Martin, Pascaline Mèlèmè is 40 years old. The couple have two children, not all in school but in their care. She and her husband live together with their children and jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Pascaline has had little schooling. For nearly ten years, she has been making her sales at a public location in Benin. She operates this business with passion, and this enables her to support herself and her children. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Pascaline is requesting a third loan, which will be used by her to respond better to customer demands and to make more profit. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and yams

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda enjoys her daily doings as a housewife. She is 47 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer and at the same time a company driver. Imelda engages in a hog-raising business primarily with hogs for breeding. She is responsible for managing their farm if her husband is out of town, especially when he is called by his boss. 

Imelda earns PHP 10,000 in her business in every four months, when her hogs are sold. Her husband earns PHP 8,000 per month from his salary as a driver, but still it is not enough to pay for feed for the hogs as Imelda prioritizes paying allowances for her children in school. Therefore, Imelda is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She believes that with the loan she will not have difficulties to finance feed for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Ms Nargis is a 33-year-old, energetic, married woman. For the last three years, she has been doing a business manufacturing  ‘baan’ (which is a material used in making charpoy (a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan).

She offers various kinds of baan in different colors, and she is famous for providing good quality materiel in her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members. Her husband is an employee in a sugar mill whose income is not sufficient to cover the everyday expenditures of his family. She is a mother of two, both are going to school. 

She wants to improve her business so she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy another baan-making machine for her son to assist her in his free time. She is expecting boost in her earnings and desires to use the earned income on the renovation of her house.

loans.use: To buy another 'baan'-making machine.

loans.name: Jerold

texts.en:
His main reason why he is working hard is for the education of his children. Jerold is in his thirties, married and has two siblings. Planting rice crops and hog-raising is their family's main source of income. He has been in this business for almost 11 years.

His time in the hog-raising business means that he has developed a strategy to grow his hogs quickly and healthily. Jerold says that he finances his hog-raising business with the support of traders. He gets feed from the traders if it is available, but if it is not offered he gets financial support from them. 

Since traders have high interest rates, Jerold realized that most of his profit went on the interest payments. Jerold decided to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 from ASKI to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs. He hopes to maintain the business and improve it so it grows.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy, a married woman, has 2 children. She is 44 years old and resides in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living and has had this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000. 

Ludy has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase spare parts for the improvement of her vehicle. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, she plans to save her earnings for the education of her children and to purchase one more motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a 47-year old resident of Balingcolong, Tangub City. She provides for her 2 children from the modest amount of 3,000 PHP she earns monthly from her piggery business. She has had this business for 10 years, and it is an aid to the income gained by her husband. Since 2009 Vilma has been a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a loan of 8,500 PHP to buy feeding supplies. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 71 years old. Bonifacia is a widow and has four children. To make a living, Bonifacia cultivates bananas for sale. Bonifacia has been in her business for 10 years and earns 4,300 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for these activities. 

Bonifacia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2007, Bonifacia joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Sissigbe Group

texts.fr: SISSIGBE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Emma (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est marié à un certain Pierre. Emma est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Emma vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Emma n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Emma mène comme activité la vente de maïs et de riz de façon ambulante. Emma mène cette activité afin de pourvoir aux besoins du ménage. Emma s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Emma sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe SISSIGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
SISSIGBE is a group of four persons whose members are friends residing in the same district. The group's representative, Emma (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old and married to a man named Pierre. She is the mother of five children, all in school and in the couple's care. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse expenses are covered. 

Emma never attended school. For nearly fifteen years, she has been running a business going from place to place selling corn and rice. She operates this business to meet the needs of her household. She gets her supplies from a region in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Emma is requesting, along with the other members of the group SISSIGBE, a third loan. This loan will be used by them to respond better to the demands of their customers and to make more profit. The previous  loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase corn and rice

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is a 43-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is twenty-one while the youngest is ten. She engages in basket weaving. She earns four thousand pesos a month by doing the basket weaving. She has been in the basket-weaving business for ten years. Her husband is a construction worker. 

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy buri (palm) and wicker (hard-woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture. Wicker is often made of material of plant origin, but plastic fibers are also used). Nila would like to expand her business to improve their standard of living and at the same time to save for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy buri (palm) and wicker.

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Mr Batdorj is 33 years old and lives with his wife in a Ger in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife, Delgermaa, is 32 years old and unemployed. He has been working in several industries since 2001. He has been driving for years now and he is an experienced driver who is now starting his own business, running a taxi service with his own car. 

However, his car needs some maintenance in order for it to be able to fun as a taxi smoothly and without any temporary stopping. The Mongolian winter is very cold and roads get slippery and because of that, car accidents and other problems arise. He is a hardworking and honest person and he is asking for 1,000,000 MNT to purchase new tires and cover other maintenance necessary for his car to be able to carry out the new taxi service business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and pay for maintenance of his car so he can provide his taxi service.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is from Maloro, Tangub City. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She runs a snack food vending business for a living. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Raquel joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to buy bananas and other snack foods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas and other snack foods to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 34 years old and is married, with six children who are all in school.  She lives in Nakuru.

Elizabeth has a grocery business that she has been doing for the past four years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD. The loan will  enable her to buy more tomatoes to add to her stock for sale, so that she can meet the demand of her customers. She is optimistic that the business will do better after the loan.

She hopes to make more profit and be able to take care of and educate her children well.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to add to her stock for sale.

loans.name: Po

texts.en: Po is 53 years old. She is widowed and resides with her five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Po is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike, for her son to run a taxi service. This purchase will enable him to generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her youngest child earn higher education. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to run a taxi service

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is the third child among four siblings. She is single and a business-oriented woman. She is happily living with her parents. She started running her variety store when she was 30 years old. Her only dream in life is to earn enough profit and have a comfortable lifestyle. Since she is the only single child in the family, she is responsible for taking care of her parents. 

Shirley would like to re-stock her variety store so she can increase her sales and profit. So she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000. She knows that it will help her very much, most especially in expanding her variety store. In addition, she could satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy volumes of merchandise for her retail store.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona lives with her spouse and three children in the village of Bugallon Proper. She is 45 years old and married. Alona manages a refreshment stall and offers a variety of street foods. Meanwhile, she rents her food stall which costs PHP 3,000 a month. According to her, half of her income goes in rent of her stall so she struggles with a shortage of capital.

With regard to this situation, she is seeking a loan of PHP 7,000. This amount will allow her to buy stocks of soft drinks, frozen foods and various kinds of street foods. She is hoping that this loan amount will be granted so she can get ahead in life and establish her own refreshment stall someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soft drinks, frozen foods and various kinds of street foods for her food stall.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
This is Marylin, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronildo, a government employee and the father of her child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continue providing income for their everyday expenses. 

Marylin runs an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and others, as well as a variety of hanging plants. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and members of the community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her to continue operating her business, Marylin is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the money to buy fertilizer and garden inputs. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Marylin dreams of growing her business in the coming years and hopes to have a peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs.

loans.name: Russia

texts.en:
Russia is 35 years old, from Olkalou, is married and has five children, who are all in school.

Russia has a food stall business that she has been running for the past two years; she cooks a variety of dishes. Russia has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy food ingredients, like cooking oil, maize flour, tomatoes and onions, for use in her business to make and sell prepared foods.

She hopes to be able to open up a big hotel in the near future.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, maize flour, tomatoes and onions, for use in her business to make and sell prepared foods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Eneria is from Litapan, Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old, married and has eight children. To make a living, Eneria raises bananas and coconuts for sale. Eneria has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns about 12,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2006, Eneria joined GDMPC. Eneria is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 47-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in seaweed farming for more than five years now. 
Esterlita wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. She is requesting a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, nylon and rope. She believes that through this loan she can enhance their seaweed production and eventually their income.

Esterlita is positive that, in the future, she can improve their living standards and experience fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, nylon and rope.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo aims to get ahead in life and give quality education to his three children. His family's main source of income comes from his farm and livestock business. Guillermo is married to a midwife who works in his municipality. At this time, Guillermo is raising two sows and four hogs to be fattened. He has run this type of business for five years now. Aside from raising hogs, he also grows corn crops on his two hectares of land.

Guillermo's goal pushes him to strive hard in order to attain it. For now, he devotes his time wisely to his farm and livestock business.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs and farm inputs for his corn field.

loans.name: Marylen

texts.en:
Marylen is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children. She is from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in seaweed farming for more than ten years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Marylen wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do. She is asking for a loan to buy straw, seaweed seedlings and other materials for seaweed farming.

In the future, Marylen wants to make her seaweed business a success and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy straw, seaweed seedlings and other materials for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
This is Precila. She previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business finances. 

Precila would like to apply for another loan of 30,000 PHP for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in more business profits, which will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial boost with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Precila hopes to expand her business soon and dreams of having a child. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah has been involved in a business doing direct selling for seven years. She is 31 years old and married to a victory driver. The couple is thankful because they are blessed with two children who are currently studying.

Leah offers a variety of cosmetic products, personal collections and different kinds of ready-to-wear. According to her, this kind of business is quite difficult to manage because some customers delay payment. Though she experienced hard times in running this business still she finds alternative ways to develop her marketing strategies. One of her marketing strategies now, is to offer her products on a cash basis but with big discounted rates so she can dispose of them immediately. With her marketing strategy, she is able to gain better profit compared to her previous income.

Now she is requesting an additional working capital amount of PHP 7,000 which will be used to buy stocks of blouses, personal collection, wallets and cosmetic products. She is doing this as she has many orders and to ensure continuous growth of her direct selling business.She is hoping that her sacrifices and wise management will lead her to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of blouses, wallets and cosmetic products for her vending activity.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a widow woman, with two children. At this time, she is living with one of her grandchildren because her two children are married and living separately from her. Clarita offers different kinds of vegetables and spices at the market of Cordon. In addition, she is also raising two hogs to be fattened. At her age, 58, she would like to have a stable source of income and be able to send her grandchild to a higher level of education.

Clarita would like to take out a loan of PHP 11,000. This will allow her to buy stocks of charcoal, onions, garlic and various kinds of vegetables. She has been doing this marketing strategy because the price of the said vegetables and spices will increase this coming Christmas season. Clarita is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount. In this way, she could obtain her goal in life.

loans.use: to buy stocks of charcoal, onions, garlic and various kinds of vegetables for her retail stall.

loans.name: 9 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “9 DE NOVIEMBRE”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carmen es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, compra y venta de repuestos, venta de muebles usados, venta de comida, compra de chatarras, venta de fruta, cerrajería, venta de chamarras y camisas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carmen es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de una tía que participa en una banca comunal. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de cerrajería (soldado de metal); cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió desde hace años atrás aprendiendo este oficio de uno de sus familiares.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de compra de fierro) que adquirirá de las ferreterías posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializa en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de las asesoras y del área de salud.
texts.en:
The November 9th Communal Bank is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Carmen as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as making woven sweaters, buying and selling spare parts, selling used furniture, selling food, selling scrap metal, selling fruit, metal work, and selling jackets and shirts.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, such as Sra. Carmen who is one of the members. She says that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago after receiving an invitation from an aunt who also participates in a Communal Bank. At the moment, Carmen operates a metal shop. She learned this trade years ago from one of her relatives.

The loan she is receiving now will increase her capital for purchasing iron. She acquires her supplies from hardware shops and then makes the products that she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate the income she needs to support her family financially. Carmen is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Carmen said that she enjoys the seminars given by the consultants and the health classes.

loans.use: to buy iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Irekpo-Lodjou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IREKPO-LODJOU est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies ayant un lien de parentés. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sofiatou Ololadé est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sofiatou Ololadé est âgée de 28 ans et est mère d’un enfant non scolarisé. Sofiatou Ololadé vit ensemble avec son mari et son unique enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins. Sofiatou Ololadé a peu fréquenté l'école. Il y a quatre années que Sofiatou Ololadé mène comme activité la vente de divers articles et des produits cosmétiques à son domicile et dans une ville du Bénin. Sofiatou Ololadé s’approvisionne au Nigéria. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Sofiatou Ololadé n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Sofiatou Ololadé et les autres membres du groupe IREKPO-LODJOU sollicitent ensemble un  premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Irekpo-Lodjou group is made of 3 people who are friends and also share family ties. The representative of the group, named Sofiatou Ololadé, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the first time that this group has sought financial support from Alidé in order to increase their business. 

Sofiatou Ololadé is 28 years old and a mother of one child who has not been to school. She lives together with her husband and her only child. Together, the couple takes care of their different needs. Sofiatou Ololadé did not go to school.

For four years Sofiatou Ololadé has been selling various goods and cosmetics from her home and in a town in Benin. She procures her goods from Nigeria. 

Customer requests are increasing but given her limited means, Sofiatou Ololadé can no longer meet their needs. Because of this, she and the other members of the Irekpo-Lodjou group are seeking this first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other various goods

loans.name: Ayidote 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE 5 est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Brigitte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Brigitte est âgée de 57 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Crespin. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à leur charge. Brigitte n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Brigitte vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Brigitte assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Brigitte vend du riz et de l’huile végétale à son domicile. Brigitte exerce cette activité depuis douze ans. Brigitte s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Brigitte sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE 5, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Ayidote 5 group is made up of four people who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, whose name is Brigitte, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Brigitte is 57 years old and married to a mason called Crespin. The couple has five children, some of whom are at school and two of whom they still support. Brigitte did not go to school. She lives with her children and husband. She and her husband provide for the household's various needs between them. In order to cover the various expenses, Brigitte sells rice and vegetable oil from home. She has been carrying out this activity for the past 12 years. She gets her supplies in her region. In order to satisfy her customers' demand and increase her turnover and income, Brigitte is, together with the other members of the Ayidote 5 group, requesting a third loan from Alidé. This loan will enable them to increase their stock and customers. The previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Willington Jhoan

texts.es:
Willington es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy alegre, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Willington se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Comunicaciones, en sus ratos libres le gusta trabajar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Willington trabaja como conductor de un programa en una pequeña televisora de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 5 horas y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador y divertido.
Willington se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de disfraces y materiales para escenografía de su programa, así pues Willington tendrá todo lo necesario para poder mejorar su programa y así aumentar su sintonía, así pues Willinton seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para convertirse en un buen profesional y desea poder lograr su gran sueño de tener su casas propia.
texts.en:
Willington is a 21-year-old gentleman who is single and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings. He is a cheerful, hardworking, and enthusiastic individual who has the drive to succeed. Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Willington was able to study for a professional degree in Communications. In his free time he enjoys working, but on a few occasions he will prepare a delicious dish of “arroz chaufa” (Peruvian fried rice) to share with his family.

With great effort and dedication, and through his own initiative, Willington now works as a producer of a small television program in his city. He begins his works every day in the early morning hours. Willington works approximately five hours and believes he is doing well because he is responsible, hardworking, and fun-loving.

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, Willington will be able to buy costumes and set design materials for his program. As a result, he will have everything he needs to improve his program and increase his audience. Willington continues to work and strive toward becoming a successful professional. He wants to achieve his greatest dream of having a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy costumes and set design materials.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a young entrepreneur from Yerevan. He lives with his mother and brother. Artur runs a little shop, where he sells fruits and vegetables. To transport fruits and vegetables Artur needs a car, which is why he applied for this loan. The car will give an opportunity to Artur to decrease costs and earn more profit. 

With the requested loan amount Artur will also purchase fruits and vegetables for his shop. By allowing Artur to buy more fruits and vegetables to offer in the shop, the loan will help Artur to increase sales.  

He will use profit to invest in further expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater amount of fruits & vegetables, and buy a car to transport them to his shop.

loans.name: Libia Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Libia se encuentra realizando su primer crédito en el banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por el sector del Vecino en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió, pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, también se puede disfrutar de su cultura, sus tradiciones y su gastronomía.

Doña Libia tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y no ha concebido hijos, su esposo es un profesional y ejerce la Abogacía, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Ella tiene desde hace 8 años en un restaurante en el cual trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, en su negocio realiza una gran variedad de platos típicos. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la preparación de sus productos.
 
Su meta es de ampliar su negocio y llegar a tener un chef profesional para la elaboración de sus platos.
texts.en:
Sra. Libia is receiving her first loan from the Communal Bank “Loma de La Cruz” (Hill of the Cross). She lives in the sector of Vecino in the city of Cuenca, a place where the weather is cold and the people have very warm hearts. There are several places within Cuenca to enjoy nature, as well as the local culture, traditions, and food.

Doña Libia is 48 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband is an attorney by profession. They own the house in which they live.

Libia has managed a restaurant for eight years. She works Sunday through Sunday without a set schedule. In her business, she offers a wide variety of traditional dishes. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of ingredients for preparing her dishes. Libia’s goals are to expand her business and to hire a professional chef for preparing her dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Diosylina

texts.en:
Diosylina is a 39-year-old, married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest child is 18, while the youngest is 7 years old. Her husband is a carpenter.

Diosylina raises hogs. She has been in the hog-raising business for ten years. She earns 2,500 Philippine pesos a month by doing the hog-raising business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy feed, additional piglets to raise, and pig supplements, like anti-anemia to help the pigs to grow healthy.

Diosylina would like to expand her business, by investing in other business ventures. She wants to support her family, as well as to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed, additional piglets to raise, and pig supplements to keep them healthy.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is 27 years old, from Nakuru, and is married. He has three children, who are all in school.

Chrispine has a tailoring business that he has been doing for the past eight years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fabrics and other materials, to add to his stock. 

He hopes to buy a plot of land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and other materials, to add to the stock of his tailoring business.

loans.name: Maripositas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIPOSITAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: encuadernación, macramé de mantas, venta de CD’s producción de mantas, tejido de mantas, venta de chinelas, venta de tarjetas chip, hilado de lana, chofer.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por ingresando por invitación de una amiga que participa en una banca comunal. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió desde hace años atrás aprendiendo este oficio de uno de una de sus amigas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializa en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Elena por encontrarse en la consulta médica.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Maripositas” (Little Butterflies) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. This group consists of 10 members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Juana as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as picture framing, producing macramé blankets, selling CDs, weaving blankets, selling slippers, selling memory chips, making wool thread, and providing transportation services.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, such as Sra. Juana who is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who also participates in a Communal Bank. At the moment, she has a business of producing woven blankets. Juana says that she started her business years ago after she learned this trade from one of her friends.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool. She acquires her supplies from distribution shops and then produces what she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate the income she needs to support her family financially. Juana is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Juana said that she enjoys sharing with her fellow group members. In the photograph, Sra. Elena was not present because she had a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Denis Roberto

texts.es: Denis tiene 48 años de edad, es casado, vive en el municipio de tela Atlántida junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Denis tiene un taller de sastrería para confeccionar pantalones de vestir. Además hace 4 años que decidió vender ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y calzado, para generar otros ingresos. Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar ropa nueva para damas, caballeros y niños y calzado para aprovechar la temporada navideña e incrementar las ventas. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda de ropa, mejorar su calidad de vida y superarse espiritualmente.
texts.en:
Denis is 48 years old, married, and lives in the town of Tela Atlántida with his wife and two children. He has a tailoring shop where he produces dress slacks. Four years ago, he decided that he also wanted to sell clothing for women, men, children, as well as shoes, so that he could generate additional income.

He is currently requesting a loan of 25,000 HNL so that he can buy new clothing for women, men, and children, as well as shoes, so that he can take advantage of the Christmas season to increase his sales. His goals are to open a clothing store, improve his quality of life, and better himself spiritually.

loans.use: to buy shoes and new clothing for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant corn

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de camaras digitales,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria,llevando a isntituciones o amigos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las camaras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar camaras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Susan is continuing with her business selling digital cameras.  She sells from place to place, taking her products to institutions or to friends.  She works from 8am until 6pm.  Susan has already had this business for 5 years, and it is going very well.  Susan's dream is to have her own store where she could sell cameras.  She is requesting a loan to buy cameras.

Susan is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy cameras

loans.name: Lebina

texts.en:
Lebina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket-weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed to make more baskets.

NWTF is relisting Lebina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to make more baskets.

loans.name: Annah Muthoni

texts.en:
Annah who farms in Ndunyu Njeru town, used her previous loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming. It was profitable and she was able to pay the loan well and in good time.

This will be her fourth loan. She plans to use the amount to buy a cow and boost her dairy farming business. This will enable her to increase her milk stock and supply milk to more customers.She also plans to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm.

She hopes to invest more in her farming business by planting on large scale to make more income.

loans.use: to buy  a cow as well as fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is a cash-crop and poultry farmer in Nyahururu town. She has been in the business for 16 years. She is 51 years old and married to Peter. They have two children.

This is her second loan and she plans to use the amount to buy broiler chickens for rearing. She will later sell the chickens and the eggs, too. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Felista hopes to grow her farming business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy broiler chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Maguinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Maguinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from basket weaving.  Maguinda is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase additional grocery items like detergents, sardines, and snack foods for her general store business.

Maguinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items like detergents, sardines, and snack foods.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 50 years old and is married with three children.

Zosima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Zosima has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is from Nakuru, Kenya. He is 25 years old and is not yet married.

Samuel has a motorcycle transport business. He has been in this business for the past three years and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy another motorcycle to add to his stock.

Samuel hopes to own a taxi in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling used clothes in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Agustina requested a loan of 14000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more used clothes to sell.

In the future, Agustina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Arlita

texts.en:
Arlita is 59 years old, married and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Arlita has a shells-crafting business in the Philippines. Arlita requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy raw materials for her shells-crafting business.

Arlita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Arlita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her shells-crafting business.

loans.name: Estela Maria

texts.es:
La señora Estela Maria esta casada, tiene 33 años de edad, cursó los grados de educacion primaria, tiene 4 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al tejido y producción de corte3s típicos, inicio este trabajo siendo operaria, y hasta ahora  lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica también a la tejeduría.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, y así incrementar su producción, ya que hay demanda de su trabajo, espera en el futuro tener mas trabajadores para su negocios.
texts.en:
Sra. Estela Maria is 33 years old, married, and finished her elementary school education. She has four children, three of whom are studying. Estela Maria is a weaver who produces traditional skirts. She started out working as an operator, but now she has eight years of experience. Estela Maria has the support of her husband, who is also a weaver.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy thread of different types and colors so that she can increase production since there is already demand for her work. In the future, she hopes to hire more workers for her business.

loans.use: to buy different types of thread for making traditional woven skirts.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita realizar la reparación en el techo del negocio comprando  los materiales y pagando mano de obra para realizar el trabajo, esta nueva inversión le ayudará para que pueda tener un negocio más seguro en mejores condiciones.

Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior mejoró su disponibilidad en el negocio, durante este tiempo sus circunstancias familiares se han mantenido, el negocio le ha generado lo necesario en ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Alba is requesting a new loan because she needs to repair the roof over her business, buy the necessary materials, and pay for the labor required to complete this job. This new investment will help her to have a more secure business with better conditions.

Alba says that her previous loan helped to improve the availability of stock for her business. During this time, she has been able to maintain her family’s condition. Her business has generated the required income to cover their necessities.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor so that the roof over her business can be repaired.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 39 years old and married with five children. All of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ester has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for 12000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Ester has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is busy with her business even at the age of 53. She sells generic medicines near her home. She was married to Jesus, a simple rice farmer. She has only two children: Joland, 38, who works as a construction worker abroad, and Jijilyn, a college graduate with a degree in Education who works as a domestic helper in Hong Kong. 

Yolanda sells different generic medicines to the village stores in her hometown. She generates a daily net income of PHP 300 through her business. In order to improve her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. She will use the loan to buy sufficient stock of medicines to meet her customers’ demands. She also plans to start a business of buying and selling bagoong (shrimp paste) that can generate additional income. As a mother, she also dreams of a more comfortable life for her family and strives hard to attain her dream. She hopes that her business will grow by the help of God and with her patience and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her business.

loans.name: Federica

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Federica works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Federica is borrowing 18000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional trisikad and spare parts for her trisikad transportation business.

Federica has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional trisikad and spare parts.

loans.name: Esmeralda Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora esmeralda, es una comerciante que se dedica a vender ropa nueva en el municipio de san Rafael del sur, Managua.
Ella tiene diez años de ejercer este oficio donde obtiene ingresos para contribuir al gasto familiar y apoyar a su esposo con la responsabilidad de sus hijos.

En estos momentos necesita del apoyo financiero de kiva para mejorar considerablemente su actividad comercial y en brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a cuidar una quinta en una zona turística de san Rafael del sur, sin embargo ella tomo la iniciativa de poner su propio negocio.
Es una persona con principios cristianos y con deseos de superación personal.
texts.en:
Sra. Esmeralda is a merchant who sells new clothing in the town of San Rafael del Sur, Managua. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and is able to generate an income to help with the family expenses and to assist her husband with supporting their children.

At the moment, she needs financial support from Kiva so that she can make considerable improvements to her business and provide better service to her customers. Esmeralda previously worked as a caretaker of a farm located in a tourism district of San Rafael del Sur. However, she took the initiative to start her own business.

Esmeralda is woman of Christian principles and has the desire to succeed on a personal level.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's trousers, shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggplants to resell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en: Aurora, 50, is a sari-sari store (community-based store) owner in the village of San Juan where she is married to Loreto, a farmer and driver of a passenger tricycle in their village. The couple has three children: Brena, 34 years old, a college undergraduate and already married; Eveth, and the youngest, Loreto Jr., 25 years old, a high school graduate, now helping his father on their farm and with the tricycle operation. Aurora is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 for the expansion of her business. She plans to sell meat and other products that will cater to the needs of her customers and also to buy more groceries for her store. She is hoping for a continuous development in her business for the benefit of her family. Aurora is saving money for times of emergency and believes that with her dedication, she will somehow become successful, always keeping in mind the axiom, “Try and try until you succeed.”

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, and spices for her store.

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
Claudia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería de temporada juguetes, accesorios, artesanía, y otros productos para la venta, se le permitirá mejorar la condición del negocio y seguir trabajando diariamente en las ventas.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo mejorando la condición del negocio hasta el momento ha mantenido una situación estable en su familia ha mejorado su capacidad de pago a las deudas.
texts.en:
Claudia has decided to take out a new loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise: toys, accessories, crafts, and other items to sell. This will allow her to improve her business and continue working every day.
Her previous loan improved the condition of her business. Her family situation has been stable and her capacity to repay her debts has increased.

loans.use: to buy toys, accessories and crafts.

loans.name: Ernesto Antonio

texts.es:
Ernesto, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo por la facilidad de pago que se le brinda y por qué ha trabajado bien con la institución, se comprará accesorios y repuestos para computadoras, tarjetas, memorias, regletas, que son necesarias para aumentar el inventario.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, con él material que compró obtuvo mejores ingresos y una mejor atención a los clientes atendidos en una con estabilidad en su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ernesto has decided to take out a new loan because the institution makes it easy to pay and because he worked well with the institution. He will purchase accessories and spare parts for computers: cards, memory, and extensions. These items are necessary for increasing his inventory.
His previous loan had a positive impact on his business. With the new products he purchased, he made a better income and was able to provide better customer service. His living conditions are stable.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories: cards, memory, and extensions.

loans.name: Manya
