La señora Micaela esta soltera, tiene 23 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a las oficios domésticos, y a la sastrería, la confección de gabachas, delantales, pantalones, etc. Iniciando este negocio como operaria, y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de una maquina de costura plana, ya que espera a tener una producción mayor en su negocio, y obtener mejores ganancias, en el futuro espera tener varias maquinas y poder dar empleos a otras personas. Las demás integrantes se dedican al mismo trabajo, la confección de tejidos.
texts.en:
Sra. Micaela is 23 years old, single, and did not have the opportunity to attend school. She devotes her time to taking care of the household duties and to sewing. Micaela produces smocks, aprons, trousers, and other items. She started out working as an operator, but now she has five years of experience.

Micaela organized a group so that she could request a loan. She will use the money to buy an upright sewing machine. Micaela hopes to be more productive in her business and generate better earnings. In the future, she hopes to have several machines and provide jobs to other people. The other members engage in the same type of work, either sewing or weaving.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Cecilia Ramona

texts.es: Cecilia tiene  57  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar frijoles para siembra y a su vez contratar mano de obra. ella desea iniciar un nuevo proyecto donde le genere ganancias para poder salir adelante junto a su esposo, ya que este no se encuentra en las capacidades necesarias para mantener su hogar, y por lo que esta señora con un espíritu de superación tiene que velar por los dos, y a decidido encaminar su plan de negocio, pero debido a sus bajos recursos no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la esta compra, ni para contratar personas que le colaboren con las labores, que dicho negocio necesita para alcanzar la meta deseada, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 57 year old married woman who lives with her husband.  With this loan, she intends to purchase beans to plant and to contract manual labor.  She wishes to start a new project that will generate revenue so she can come out ahead with her husband as he no longer has the capacity to maintain their home and she has to fend for both of them.  

She has decided to start her business but because of her lack of resources she hasn't been able to purchase the beans nor the labor to start said business.  This is why she is seeking a loan.  It is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has never had a loan from a commercial bank but FUDECOSUR has granted her the loan with much less difficulty and lower interest rates.

loans.use: siemb de frijoles

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 44-year-old married woman with two children from Antequera, Bohol. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been in the sari-sari store business for five years. Victoria sells commodities like rice, sugar, soft drinks and canned goods. She earns six thousand pesos a month with her sari-sari store business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional groceries to sell like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and sugar. Victoria hopes that her business will prosper so that she will be able to raise her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his rice agriculture business by cultivating large quantities of rice for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 54-year-old married man with seven children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For 33 years he has been serving as a policeman; he joined the profession due to his love for peace and harmony. Like all good fathers, Stephen dreams of seeing his children graduate and setting up sustainable income generating activities to help them in the future, despite the challenge of getting low salary pay. Stephen is requesting a loan to pay for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to pay for the school fees of his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 45 years old. She has been running a green grocery business for the past four years, earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000. Beatrice is applying for her fifth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. She used the previous loans to buy green vegetables and fruits.

Beatrice will use the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. 

Her hope and dream is to open a retail shop and expand her grocery business, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a 57-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business for several years now. Her husband works as a fisherman. Virgilia works hard to provide support to her husband in meeting the needs of their family.

Virgilia dreams of expanding their fishing ventures but lacks the financial resources to do so. She is asking for a loan from CEVI and has been a member for some time now. The loan will be used to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, a bucket, and fuel for the fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish at the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, a bucket, and fuel for her fishing boat

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita is a mother of six children between the ages of 13 and one year old; five of them go to school. She comes from the Ashklai community. She is a housewife, and her husband works for a very low salary.

Drita always wanted to renovate her house but she never had enough money. She is now requesting 500 euros as a loan in order to do these renovations to improve the doors and windows and to paint the house. This loan will help to improve her living conditions. 

Her goal is to give her children the best future and to save money for them. She and her family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate the doors and windows and to paint her house

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 24 years old and a business lady. She is married to Stephen. She has been a tailor for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 8,500, which she uses to support her family.

Susan is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully since her business did well. She used the loan to buy textile materials. Susan will use the loan to buy a modern sewing machine. 

With the anticipated profit from her business, she will support her parents. Her hope is to open her own boutique shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy more textile materials.

loans.name: Dianah's Group

texts.en:
Dianah's group is comprised of two hard working women. Dianah is 22 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, Dianah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Dianah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food to sell, and will help Dianah to generate greater profits and support her mother. Dianah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Dianah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy food to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 43 year-old married woman and a mother of an 18 year-old daughter from San Jose, Talibon. She and her husband have been involved in rice farming business for more than ten years now. 

Evelyn has been a member of CEVI for several years now. She joined CEVI because she wanted to gain access to the loan and insurance services offered to microentrepreneurs like her.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the rice plantation. With this, she and her husband will be able to increase their crop yield and their profit.

In the future, Evelyn wants to expand the business and explore other ventures to increase the income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the rice plantation.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 32 years old. She is married to a driver, and they have one child, aged six years. Valentine sells clothes and has been in the business for the past six years. She wants a loan to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used as savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.
